title: beastier demo
text: vignette demonstrates use beastier. First, load library: Also, ’ll load testthat library, verify statements vignette: run BEAST2, need create BEAST2 options structure`. use supplied BEAST2 XML file. rest, ’ll use default options: running BEAST2, BEAST2 input file must exist, expect output file created just yet: can run beastier now, BEAST2 installed. BEAST2 needs installed user, vignette checks installed every step: beastier run BEAST2, BEAST2 output can shown: beastier run BEAST2, MCMC’s final state saved file: final state can used continue run.
code: library(beastier) library(testthat) beast2_options <- create_beast2_options(   input_filename = get_beastier_path("2_4.xml") ) names(beast2_options) #> [1] "input_filename"        "output_state_filename" "rng_seed"              #> [4] "n_threads"             "use_beagle"            "overwrite"             #> [7] "beast2_path"           "verbose" expect_true(file.exists(beast2_options$input_filename)) expect_false(file.exists(beast2_options$output_state_filename)) if (is_beast2_installed()) {   output <- run_beast2_from_options(beast2_options) } if (is_beast2_installed()) {   print(output) } if (is_beast2_installed()) {   expect_true(file.exists(beast2_options$output_state_filename))   file.remove(beast2_options$output_state_filename) } beastier::remove_beaustier_folders()

title: Call BEAST2
text: Run BEAST2: create files specified 2_4.xml BEAST2 input file.
code: output_state_filename <- "out.state"  run_beast2(   input_filename = get_beastier_path("2_4.xml"),   output_state_filename = output_state_filename )

title: Call BEAST2
text: Note version, filenames .log .trees files specified. unneeded: 2_4.xml BEAST2 input file specifies files stored: using beautier, can specified create_mcmc:
code: output_log_filename <- "out.log" output_trees_filename <- "out.trees" output_state_filename <- "out.state"  run_beast2(   input_filename = get_beastier_path("2_4.xml"),   output_log_filename = output_log_filename,   output_trees_filenames = output_trees_filename,   output_state_filename = output_state_filename ) <?xml [...]?><beast [...]>  [...]  <run [...]>      [...]      <logger id="tracelog" fileName="test_output_0.log" [...]>         [...]     </logger>      [...]      <logger id="treelog.t:[...]" fileName="$(tree).trees" [...]>         [...]     </logger> </run> </beast> create_mcmc(   tracelog = create_tracelog(     filename = "my_trace.log"   ),   treeslog = create_treeslog(     filename = "my_trees.trees"   ) )

title: Function to create a set of BEAST2 options. — create_beast2_options
text: input_filename name BEAST2 input XML file. file usually .xml extension. Use create_temp_input_filename create temporary filename extension. output_state_filename name .xml.state file create. Use create_temp_state_filename create temporary filename extension. rng_seed random number generator seed BEAST2 run. Must non-zero positive integer value NA. rng_seed NA, BEAST2 pick random seed n_threads number computational threads use. Use NA use BEAST2 default 1. use_beagle use BEAGLE present overwrite TRUE: overwrite .log .trees files one exists. FALSE, BEAST2 started .log file exists .trees files exist .log file created BEAST2 exists .trees files created BEAST2 exist beast2_path name either BEAST2 binary file (usually simply beast) BEAST2 jar file (usually .jar extension). Use get_default_beast2_bin_path get default BEAST binary file's path Use get_default_beast2_jar_path get default BEAST jar file's path verbose TRUE, additional information displayed, potentially useful debugging

text: input_filename name BEAST2 input XML file. file usually .xml extension. Use create_temp_input_filename create temporary filename extension. output_state_filename name .xml.state file create. Use create_temp_state_filename create temporary filename extension. rng_seed random number generator seed BEAST2 run. Must non-zero positive integer value NA. rng_seed NA, BEAST2 pick random seed n_threads number computational threads use. Use NA use BEAST2 default 1. use_beagle use BEAGLE present overwrite TRUE: overwrite .log .trees files one exists. FALSE, BEAST2 started .log file exists .trees files exist .log file created BEAST2 exists .trees files created BEAST2 exist beast2_path name either BEAST2 binary file (usually simply beast) BEAST2 jar file (usually .jar extension).
